page.title: 10F of D Berry Hill
page.content: {Berry Hill is an important built up {area about one mile from Coleford. There are views from here of the Malvern Hills and the Black Mountains. {It is a recent settlement-not more {than two hundred years}old.It grew up as mining{expanded.Housing is council and{privately owned.It has one small {supermarket,two garages,two post {offices,a dairy,a newsagents and a {workshop for hand made furniture.It is {important for education.Berry Hill County Primary has 210 pupils.This year the grammar and secondary school has been reorganised as Lakers School- a comprehensive.It has over one thousand pupils.Both sites are next to each other.There is also a public sports centre within the school.A tertiary college is on the site for job training or for obtaining further qualifications.
